meanings.definition: The act of making something or someone barbaric.
meanings.sent1: The barbarisation of the peaceful tribe led to conflicts within the community.
meanings.sent2: The barbarisation of the once sophisticated society shocked historians.
meanings.sent3: The children's play about the toys coming to life took a dark turn with the theme of barbarisation.
meanings.sent4: The rapid industrialisation of the town resulted in the barbarisation of its natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The gradual barbarisation of the protagonist in the novel highlighted the dangers of power.

meanings.sent1: The barbarisation of the young prince was a result of his isolation from society.
meanings.sent2: The barbarisation of the once kind ruler was a tragic tale of power corrupting.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the process of barbarisation in a humorous way.
meanings.sent4: The barbarisation of the landscape under the harsh sun made it seem like a different world.
meanings.sent5: The gradual barbarisation of the character in the movie showcased the impact of negative influences.
